text: Hi everyone, can Non-HubSpot forms accept and pass through all 5 UTMs? (content, term, campaign, source, medium)?
Please don’t post the same question in multiple channels. Find the most relevant one only.

You may want to post that code in <#C2YH119N2|hubl>. I’m not sure if it even works in email as I haven’t worked with custom objects, but I do know that not everything that works for the CMS is supported in email.

Hi everyone, My company uses HubSpot in a B2C way, and we are currently having trouble with revenue attrubution for email. It seems depending on how much you click around the site before you purchase affects what percentage of revenue gets attributed to an email. Basically all we want to do is have a way to see how many people clicked through through an email and what deals can be attributed to it.
I dont think we are the only company that is B2C that uses HubSpot and would like to know how much revenue is being created by an email / email campaign
Anyone run into the issue of the rich text module adding margin-bottom:1em to every p tag? Is there a way around that? It is messing up rendering in multiple email renders

I only get the inline styles for `mso-line-height-rule` and `line-height`. Do you have any custom email modules that use `data-hse-inline` for styles?

Those can escape the module and apply to outside elements if you use overly-general selectors.
If it’s a coded email you should be able to override it with a style tag in the head and add `data-hse-inline-css="true"` to it.
You can, but it would impact all P tags which you may not want, so you may want to add a class to it to target the rich text module only.
ok I will give that a go. Thanks for the insight

In the past, I’ve had some trouble getting `data-hse-inline` to work as intended. I recommend you also add `id="hs-inline-css"` to your style tag to mark the styles for inlining, which I’ve found more reliable.
and I just add that tag to the p tag within the rich text module and then add my margin-bottom:0 in my styles for that id <@U04AQA0QM8E>?
interesting. Thanks for the help both of you. This was insanely helpful
Hi! is it possible to add html code into automated email and just get the content? (I mean I don't need to see the <p></p> html tags)
